name: Detox
description: App E2E tests on iOS simulator. Simulator is a tool provided by Apple to mimic various devices on a mac so that we can test how the feature would look and feel. With simulators you can select the iPhone models(7,8, 11, 12 max pro) and the O/S version they are running(iOS versions 12,13,14)

name: Django
description: Python framework used in the biggest UK application including an admin interface

name: FastAPI
description: Default web framework used on Python based microservices

name: Golang
description: Used for UK infrastructure automation for speed. I have few services implemented with Golang for performance gain or simplicity. Currently we do not have Golang skillset inside the company as well as we don't see future valid use-cases for Golang. Therefore currently Golang is seeing as on-hold technology which shouldn't be picked up for new services.

name: Java
description: Currently we start all new developments with Kotlin to benefit from current language advantages over Java. However we acknowledge that with current pace Java can catchup in the future with Kotlin capabilities

name: Kotlin
description: The language used for backend development

name: Next.js
description: React framework adopted by all web applications except DE

name: Python
description: The language used for UK backend code

name: React
description: Our key technology for web development

name: React Native
description: Our choice for App development

name: Redux
description: Library for state persistence in web

name: Spring Framework
description: Our backend microservices are using Spring Boot and Spring ecosystem by default

name: Typescript
description: Our choice for web as well as for App development

name: Webpack 5 Module Federation
description: Evaluated as a solution to split DE webapp into independent modules

name: Astronomer
description: The cloud service used for hosting and managing our Airflow instance. Circle CI/CD has been integrated to ensure a quality deployments of Airflow

name: AWS Aurora
description: Evaluated as an alternative to RDS for multi-region internationalised setup

name: AWS ELB
description: LB for external traffic

name: AWS Kinesis
description: Our solution for data streaming needs. Used for both - interservice communication and data transfer to the data warehouse

name: AWS MKS (Kafka)
description: Kafka usage currently being spiked for streaming by UK team

name: AWS Postgres (RDS)
description: Postgres currently is our de facto standard for all application persistence needs. There might be benefits of NoSQL in some use-cases in particular with schema flexibility however we favour maintainability simplicity while sticking to Postgres

name: AWS S3
description: S3 is our storage for all the images and files, except editorial content that lives in CMS

name: AWS SNS
description: AWS Notification service, used in combination with SQS for message streaming

name: AWS SQS
description: Queueing in AWS

name: Contentful CMS
description: CMS solution used in various areas of My all applications mainly in martech and promotion for storing static content for our product such as make/model pages, promotions content etc.

name: Elasticsearch
description: Used for listing search, could be used for other search needs

name: Snowflake
description: Global data warehouse solution. It allows us to easily scale the platform horizontally (e.g. more nodes) or vertically (e.g. more compute).

name: App Release Managers
description: Responsible to create Beta close to the end of the sprint by triggering a workflow, After Beta is verified, creates the release build, distributes and manages rollout from Apple and Google console according to Staged Rollout practice. The overhead for the Release Manager work is minimal but it avoid ubiquity on who is handling the topic

name: Apps Staged Rollout
description: Rolling out new release by incrementing users distribution from 1% till 100% over the course of 7 days

name: Architecture Decision Records
description: The process and documentation format we use to capture important architecture decisions

name: Balanced pyramid of tests
description: We strongly encourage teams at My all applications to implement a well balanced pyramid of tests, understanding the different layers necessary to automate software testing.

name: Code reviews
description: By default all the code and configuration changes go through code review process within the teams

name: Communities of Practice
description: As of now we have Backend, Frontend and Mobile community of practice where engineers across multiple teams can exchange knowledge, discuss possible solutions to common problems and align technical decisions

name: Engineering on-call process
description: The on-call duty is a task force of dedicated who are "on-call" to fix critical issues for software services as they arise. My all applications adopts this technique in order to assure higher product uptime and 24/7 monitoring of possible issues in our systems

name: GitHub pull request model
description: All our teams by default are working with pull-request model. One of our teams is experimenting with trunk based development in combination with pair programming

name: Incidents post-mortems
description: Documented knowledge about happened incidents and collected learnings how to prevent such incidents from happening again

name: Proactive monitoring (Synthetic tests)
description: Synthetic monitoring (also known as active monitoring or proactive monitoring) allow you to observe how your systems and applications are performing using simulated requests and actions from around the globe. Some of our teams in My all applications have been using this technique for monitor application's uptime and basic rendering.

name: Trunk-based development
description: Trunk-based development (TBD) is a source-control branching model, where developers collaborate on code in a single main branch. TBD is a key enabler of Continuous Integration and by extension Continuous Delivery. Considering our success with Pair Programming in Martech team and other well established engineering practices (well-balanced pyramid of tests and infrastructure for CI/CD), TBD is currently in trial by the team.

name: Adjust
description: App channel attribution collection

name: Airflow
description: Our orchestration tool for managing DAG-based data pipelines.

name: AWS EKS (k8s)
description: Our envisioned target setup is to run k8s as managed EKS service

name: Bitrise
description: Used for mobile react native CI/CD pipeline for App

name: bugsnag
description: Bugs monitoring and reporting for App

name: CicleCI
description: CI/CD for backend and frontend components

name: ArgoCD
description: GitOPS CD for backend and frontend components

name: Datadog
description: Serves for all backend and infrastructure monitoring needs

name: Delibr
description: Tool for architectural discussions progressing to technical documents in the UK

name: Docker containers
description: De facto standard for packaging and shipping out backend microservices

name: dbt
description: SQL-based transformation tool

name: docker-compose
description: Used with Docker for local development and containerisation

name: firebase
description: Push Notification for App, also helps with Performance monitoring

name: Flagr
description: Feature flagging tool to segment users into cohorts.

name: keycloak
description: Solution we adopted for login and identity needs

name: Kibana (ELK)
description: Used for all the logs from backend components

name: kops
description: Currently in some of our markets clusters we host k8s on top of AWS resources with help of kops provisioning

name: Lighthouse
description: Used as an alternative web performance monitoring and for analysing performance impact of the changes under development before being released to production

name: Loki
description: Grafana based log displays, graphs and monitoring used in the UK

name: Looker
description: Our main reporting tool which sources data from Snowflake and Postgres RDS and present data into meaningful insights.

name: Matillion
description: Our initial orchestration tool for DAG-based. This is mainly a clickops tool which limits our ability to properly review code and can lead to improper code/data pipelines being published to production. We are in the process of migrating this to Airflow.

name: Redash
description: The visual tool and SQL client we use to work with our data in Postgres and Elastic

name: Segment
description: Our Customer Data Platform (CDP) used for integration of user tracking and customer systems data (e.g. CRM) and for defining tracking specifications.

name: Sentry
description: Used for receiving and analysing system errors from our frontend and backend components

name: Sentry performance monitoring
description: Used to measure and monitor Core Web Vitals (CWV) relevant performance metrics. The metrics reported by Sentry are used also to set performance metrics related goals

name: Terraform
description: Solution to maintain and deploy infrastructure state and make infrastructure changes

name: Testfairy
description: Build distribution on devices to test PR and Beta builds for App

name: vysor
description: Mirror actual devices to mac machines to speed up development rather than using simulators/emulators (used for App development)

name: Yarn Berry
description: Yarn Workspaces are currently evaluated as a monorepo solution for DE webapp

name: Prometheus
description: Monitoring, Alerting and Metrics gathering for kubernetes resources

name: Grafana
description: Dashboard and Graphing for Metrics

name: Atlantis
description: CI Chatops pipeline for terraform

name: Phrase
description: Translation handler for all emerging and future markets

name: Serverless Framework
description: Development solution for apps built on AWS Lambda

name: AWS Lambda
description: Auto-scaling high-availability serverless compute infrastructure

name: AWS API Gateway
description: Managed API gateway for webapps
